1.content:
You awake to your mom yelling in the hallway. She runs into your room demanding you look outside. Peering out your window, you see things are blurry and strange, plus there is grass in front of your window. "My car looks like a toy car! What's happening?!" your sister yells from the garage.

You...

11.content:
Mom is franking out about something, nothing new there! You climb out of bed still wearing your Family Guy pajamas and go WO the garage to see your sister's car is now only three feet long. "Looks like your old Barbie power Wheel!" you laugh at your sister's distress.

Your mom yelps in shock as she sees her minivan in the driveway has doubled in size. You're skeptical and believe someone is merely pranking you... Until the neighbor's "little" dog Sasha comes running into the garage the size of a grisley bear.

The friendly dog seems confused that you're now her size and licks you in the face.

choices: Tell your mom to call for help
111.content:
"Okay, this is freaky! Everyone inside!" You keep the massive beast at bay long enough to return inside the safety of your house. But things are going wrong here too.

"My microwave!" Your mom says staying alarmed now. The normally small oven has grown in size and crushes the small table it was sitting on. You notice the chandelier over the dining room table looks like it's getting further away as you watch. It's shrinking before your very eyes.
111.title: Time to panic and hide

1111.content:
"Whatever is happening, maybe it doesn't happen underground!" you ask. You and your mom head down to the basement, but your sister insists on getting her phone from her room.

"Just let her go," Your mom begs running with you downstairs. The storm shelter has a couch and emergency food. You turn on the single light bulb with the pull chord. Everything here is perfectly normal.

"We just wait here and maybe whatever government experiment went haywire will be fixed soon. Did you see the size of that dog!" You insist as your mom sits to catch her breath.
1111.title: To the basement

choices: Try to get your mom's attention
11111.content:
As you sit on the couch you wonder what is going on outside. Suddenly the light bulb flickers and goes out. "Probably a bad bulb," You say reaching for the emergency flash light. It's dim from years of sitting, but it works. You dig around for the spare bulbs when you feel the flashlight getting bigger.

"Oh, no... It's happening in here too. Mom... Mom?" You can no longer hold the flashlight as it grows to the size of a log. "Lance?" You hear your mom ask but her voice is no longer soft and subtle... It's massive as if she's talking over a concert PA system. "Lance?" Your mom picks up the flash light in her gigantic hand.

"What is taking forever, where is your sister?" Your mom is trying hard not to get hysterical. Peeking out the door, you just see the basement as usual.

"Melody!" You shout again. Suddenly you see a barbie doll jump over a billboard sized Vogue magazine and run to you.

When you hide in the storm shelter, you notice your mom is now missing. "Where could she be! Mom!" You open the door and see a broom in the corner zoom up to the size of a beach umbrella.

"Wait! I hear her!" Melody yells from your hand.

"Mister and Miss Stevens!" you throw the cat into a bedroom and slam the door shut. The tiny couple are only half the size of your sister and thanking you profusely for saving their lives.

The Stevens ask you to call their daughter Kim, you decide it could only help.

"Hello?" a lady asks you. You explain what's going on and her parents are shrunk. At first Kim does not believe you, then suddenly DOES believe you and promises to come right over.

"Okay, she's coming," you tell everyone. It's weird that your short sister is now towering overthese other people and still holding your mom like a doll in her hand.

Suddenly you feel yourself falling and before you can climb to your feet again, you see the world has blown up to massive proportions around you. "Oh no!" everyone says in unison.

122.content:
"Giants!" you yell. You your mom and Melody all run to the basement. More thuds shake the house as the giant shoes crush houses and cars as if they're toys. The basement has small windows that allow you to stand on the entertainment center and peep out.

A lady in a red dress is looking at the ground confused and steps on the neighbors houses down the street. She watches the houses flatten and the trees crush under her shoe like cotton balls. She walks away stepping over the mountain as if it's just a blanket piled on the floor.

Your mom is asking Melody how she became tiny but your sister doesn't know anything.
122.title: Hide with mom and Melody in the basement

choices: nothing happens and you walk back to your house.
you spot a growing woman, still nude and asleep, bulldozing some houses.
somebody seems to have picked up the bra on the horizon.
1222.content:
You try to comprehend the situation, but it seems impossible to figure out. Fortunately, the neighborhood has calmed and there's nothing apart from occasional tremors and noises, although they seem to be coming from far away. On the other hand there's not much to see, since most of the view is blocked by several floors high piles of rubble made by the gigantic woman just walking. You tremble with the thought that had she stepped somewhere else, you would all be dead, just like so many people must have...

No, there's no time for panic right now. You need to stay calm and survive this. There must be a way.. if only you could find what is causing this chaos, perhaps you might take some precautions.. or at least know where to hide with your mother and sister. After calming them down - Melody is still the size of a doll and mother seems to be losing it - you tell them that you will try to find out what's going on.

"No, don't go! It's safer here!" - your mother pleads at first.

You point to the craters just outside the window and reply - "If something like that comes again, then we'll be gone anyway. We need to know what's happening outside."

She struggles with the idea, but after a moment admits: "Fine, but please.. do be careful..."

"Okay, I will be back shortly" - you try to comfort them, if only you were so sure of it yourself...

After literally jumping up the stairs, you try to figure out where to start. The TV doesn't work - you quickly discover that there's no power. "Just great" - you complain to yourself, but you should have expected it.. with so much damage to the infrastructure...

You go back to your room to find that the phone is useless as well - although the batteries are almost full, charged over the night, there is no signal. The only way to survey the situation is to go outside yourself. Looking through the window you don't see any immediate dangers - there is some commotion in the neighborhood, but it's mostly people driving away. You consider that option as well, but then.. go where, exactly? The last thing you notice through the window is a sight of a young boy - five or six years old perhaps - riding a kid bike... but miles tall, effortlessly bulldozing through downtown in the distance.

You need to make sure there isn't anything like that coming your way. Walking outside, you see chaos everywhere - it didn't seem that bad from the "safety" of your home. People screaming, running around - and nobody seems to know what is going on. The worst part is just how many things isn't right with the world. Half cars are the wrong size - some toy-sized, others rivaling nearby houses - which seem to be randomly affected as well. You decide to climb the nearest pile of rubble just across the road to see the wider area.

Crossing to the other side, you see what the kid must have been running away from - far in the distance, you spot a hazy outline of a dome of some kind. It seems alien at first, but then you spot another one behind it and realize it must be bra... impossibly huge, larger than any mountain range at least dozens of miles high. You definitely would not like to meet its owner - if she was enlarged to this size as well, at least.

But from the highest point of the debris, you cannot see any other threats - the enormous lady in red dress is nowhere to be seen, the kid is driving away and although there are some overgrown pets and cars large enough to take three lanes of traffic, there is nothing in the area to endanger your home directly.

Next,
1222.title: Looking for answers

choices: Search for your Mom and Sister, they might still be inside!
No time to think, run outside!
12221.content:
Deciding that, despite what looks like a moment of safety, being caught outside is a very, very dangerous idea, you turn around and walk back towards the house. You idly wonder why you weren't effected, but so much other stuff was? Was it all luck of the draw? What could cause this to happen, anyway? With these thoughts filling your head, you don't notice the postman you just pummeled as you head back into the house.

Taking slow, careful steps, you go down to the basement to find that your sister and mom are nowhere to be found! "Mom? Sis?" you call out. No response. Did they...shrink? Or did they leave? Just then, a powerful tremor shakes the whole house. You feel the foundation of the house shake as each subsequent tremor gets stronger and stronger. No time to stick around, you have to book it!
12221.title: nothing happens and you walk back to your house.

choices: your mother coming down the stairs and asking why are you still here.
a bare foot just outside the broken window, blocking the street.
122211.content:
There's something big coming and your instinct tells you to run. Run and hide, as far away from here as possible.

"No!" - you think - "No, I cannot just leave them here. What if they are just hiding somewhere..." - you scan the basement, but there's literally nowhere for a person to hide in. Even without the light on, the windows are letting enough sunshine in to lighten all corners of the room.

You can hear a thundering words coming from the outside. You don't pay much attention to it and underground it's distorted enough so most of it is just noise. Noise and... Boom. Something really big hit the neighborhood just now. Your house can be next to be crushed, it seems like there's already too late - but you don't give up and begin to look under the furniture and behind the stuff that your parents accumulated here over the years. "It's crazy, why wouldn't they throw some of this out, it's..."

BOOM! Another tremor shakes the basement, making some items fall and breaks a window on the other side of the room, but you don't give up and continue your search.

Suddenly something catches your eye and interrupts your search - turning to the side, you see...
122211.title: Unwilling to leave behind.

choices: that means it's a woman, or girl, that you don't know.
you know who it belongs to!
1222112.content:
Tremors and noises could be felt the whole time and you were getting used to them. Sure, earlier they were more distant and much weaker, while now not only they seemed to be coming from nearby, but also were becoming increasingly stronger and louder - which, you realize, should have caught your attention already. But the sight of the gigantic foot outside the window really freaks you out and you run out from the basement.

You hide in the living room and carefully peeking through the window, you notice how the pink wall dwarfs everything else in the area. Each toe is bigger than your house and it's a miracle that you are still alive, considering that the foot could have easily crushed you. You are unable to see much more outside, since the view is blocked by either the foot, various rubble or grown objects.

You hope that the giant or giantess may pass soon, leaving you safe-ish again and able to search for your family just like earlier, but strangely enough, the foot doesn't move. Trying to figure out what are your options, you walk to the other side of the room to check if maybe you can see anything through another window, but you notice the view is obscured by another pink wall - only this time it's clearly a big toe. Or more like a huge toe - it seems at least ten times larger than the trees in the neighbor backyard.

No, wait... it would block much more of your view, if it was really that big in comparison. Then you notice the trees are barely taller than the fence - they must have shrunk! At least it's not as bad as it seemed, but there is still a gigantic foot - no, wait, two gigantic feet.. on the both sides of your house! Estimating the size, you could guess that the toe might be about thirty feet tall, which would put the person at around.. your head hurts trying to imagine this... a mile tall? Perhaps a bit smaller, but still absolutely enormous!

Then you realize another thing - the toenail... Although you can only see a small part of it, it seems that it is painted in a dark blue-green color and...

"Okay, Paris lemme call you back, I gotta check on mom again," you hang up with a sigh and get dressed for another stressful day of crazy people agrivating you.

"Mom?" you call again but get no answer. Going into the kitchen you see mom's phone on the floor but no sign of her or your sister Melody. "MOM!" you yell.

Looking out the window, you still see blurry hazy fog and shrug. Still gotta get ready for work. You eat a pop tart and try the toaster, it dosn't work. Then the TV doesn't work. The power is out. "Great," you mumble and head to the garage to leave, but your driveway is gone and theres nothing but mossy dirt and your bike is gone.

"What the hell?" you're thinking.

15.content:
Professor Willis just happens to look like actor Bruce Willis. You tear off to his house ignoring a three foot tall spider eating a two foot long ant and a one foot tall neighbor yellingat a six foot tall bird eating his garden plants.

"This is nuts!" You tell yourself and go right through the professor's garage and into his kitchen. You see his wife Emma at the sink.

"Emma, Emma! Where's professor Willis! Things are going haywire all over the place!" you say urgently. Emma slowly turns around and shows you she's not breast feeding their baby, she's breast feeding Professor Willis!

He pushes wife's tit away and looks up at you. "There you are, ha ha, just uh... How are you?" He asks nervously.

"Professor! There are things all different sizes all over the neighborhood... Do you know what's going on?" You ask.

"Oh, no..." he says in deep thought.

info.description:
Today the rules of nature do not apply to scale. One moment a bird is eating a lady bug, the next moment a mosquito is drinking from a water tower.
